snow.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: soft white pieces of frozen water that fall from the sky in cold weather and cover the ground
snow.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Snow was falling heavily as we entered the village.
I could see footprints in the snow.
The town was buried under three feet of snow.
snow.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a period of time in which snow falls
snow.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: one of the heaviest snows this winter
snow.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: small white spots on a television picture, caused by bad weather conditions, weak television signals etc
snow.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: snow falls
Outside in the dark, snow was falling silently.
snow settles
The snow was beginning to settle.
snow drifts
The snow had drifted up against the hedge.
snow covers/blankets something
The ground was covered with snow.
snow melts
The snow has melted and the ground is bare once more.
The snow was quite deep in places.
France has been expecting heavy snow all week.
I had watched the tracks I’d made disappear under fresh snow.
powdery
The powdery snow flies up as I walk through it.
wet snow
He cleared the wet snow from the car windscreen.
light snow
A light snow had begun to fall.
driving snow
We walked home through driving snow.
swirling snow
It was difficult to see in the swirling snow.
several inches/feet of snow
More than eight inches of snow fell in 48 hours.
a blanket/carpet of snow
Within an hour, Bucharest was buried under a blanket of snow.
flakes of snow
A few flakes of snow started to fall.
a flurry of snow/a snow flurry
The day was cold, with a few flurries of snow.
a fall of snow
We had our first fall of snow in mid-November.
a drift of snow
Sheep became buried in six-foot drifts of snow.
snow.translation[0].note_box[1].sections: snow
soft white frozen water that falls from the sky
The ground was covered with deep snow.
Snow began to fall.
snowflakes
pieces of snow falling from the sky
The first snowflakes fluttered down between the trees.
sleet
a mixture of snow and rain
The snow turned to sleet and then rain.
slush
snow on the road that has partly melted and is very wet
I made my way through the dirty slush.
blizzard
a storm with a lot of snow and a strong wind
We got caught in a blizzard on our way to school.
frost
white powder that covers the ground when it is cold
Frost can kill delicate plants.
hail/hailstones
drops of rain that fall as ice
Hail bounced on the tiled roof.
He heard a strange sound, like hailstones striking glass.
a white Christmas
a Christmas when there is snow
Do you think there will be a white Christmas this year?
snow.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to persuade someone to believe or support something, especially by lying to them
snow.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Millions of readers were snowed into believing it was a true story.
snow.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to have a lot more work than you can deal with
